result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyler A Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Assault by Prisoners-Confines/Restrains [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(1m)(b).
  • Assault by Prisoners-Confines/Restrains [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Any other conditions as deemed appropriate by P&P.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kyler A Williams in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Kyler A Williams in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:29 PM. State - resolved - have complied with victim notification requirements with no request for restitution or VIS - joint agreement - plead G to counts #1 and #4, counts #2 and #3 will be DRI, court costs on each count plead to, 6.5 years in WI State prison system with 18 months of ijnitial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - concurrent to each other but consecutive to his current prison term, no ES conditions considered. Richards and Williams agree. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3. Williams pleads G to counts #1 and #4 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Richards makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks court to make him eligible for challenge incarceration and substance abuse. State objects to the defendant being made eligible for the programs. Williams makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #4 - 6.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 18 months of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - concurrent to each other but consecutive to the current prison time that the defendant is serving, with conditons of: costs on each count - paid thru ES and with 25% of his prison wages, all other conditions to be added by P&P, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, eligible for challenge incarceration and substance abuse, right to appeal, adjourned.
per FOSO DNA sample is on file

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kyler A Williams in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Kyler A Williams in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:40. State - believe PH will be waived. Richards and Williams agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed Information that mirrors the complaint. Richards has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and pleas NG to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:45 pm. State will need to prepare WRIT.
Preliminary hearing at 08-06-2015 03:30 pm. Clerk sent notice for defendant to Dodge Correctional.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kyler A Williams appears via video from FOSO with attorney Steven Richards who appears telephonically. Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:51 AM. Williams has complaint and court has already advised him of charges and penalties. Richards requests PH, defendant is in custody on other matters at Dodge Correctional, will waive time limits. Court continues bond, consideres time limits waived, set for PH. State should prepare a writ unless FOSO decides to keep the prisoner here until the next hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kyler A Williams in court, in custody, appears via video from FOSO.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:31 AM. Williams does not have complaint. Court reads charges, penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Williams understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, cannot afford his own. Court instructs to contact SPD today and sent paperwork for court appointed attorney, sets for AIA. Williams is a state inmate from Dodge Correctional Institution and revocation in FC. State - bond - $1,000.00 cash bond. Court - $1000 cash bond, no contact with victim (C.H.).  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:45 am.
